stylers

Detailed Description

The group of methods of the WSS, Wednus Styling System.

Todo:
need to write an article about WSS


Variables

W style
 Apply styling.

Variable Documentation

W style

Initial value:

 function(obj, wss){
  
  if(typeof obj == 'string')
    obj = document.createElement(obj);
  var s = obj.style;
  var tmp, latestProp;
  if(!wss) return obj;
  wss = wss.split(';');
  for(var i = 0; i < wss.length; ++i){
    tmp = wss[i].split(':');
    if(typeof tmp[1] == 'undefined'){
      s[tmp[0]] = latestProp;
    }else s[tmp[0]] = latestProp = tmp[1];
  }
  return obj;
}
Apply styling.

Warning:
If you have registered an object on WPS changing top/left/width/height will not give any effect, since WPS manages those property of the object once it become registered.
Parameters:
{Object} obj the target object
{String} wss WSS(Wednus Styling System) valid string value
Returns:
{Object} object after style application
Note:
apply property/style change 
 obj.style.top = '10px';
 obj.style.left = '12px';
 obj.style.width = '100%';
 obj.style.height = '100%';
 obj.style.position = 'absolute';
This block of code can be written in one line. 
 W.style(obj, 'top:10px;left:12px;width:100%;height;position:absolute');
notice the part 'height;'. When there is no value specified, WSS uses the latest value used. for example, 
 obj.style.top = '100px';
 obj.style.left = '100px';
 obj.style.width = '100px';
 obj.style.height = '100px';
can be reduced as: 
 W.style(obj, 'top:100px;left;width;height');
